thread.title: First Annual Webster Garlic Festival raises thousands for Miracle Field
thread.title_full: First Annual Webster Garlic Festival raises thousands for Miracle Field

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: First Annual Webster Garlic Festival raises thousands for Miracle Field
text:
Webster Garlic Festival organizers presented a huge check to the Rochester “Challenger” Miracle Field last week, the proceeds from a quite successful first annual Garlic Festival. And when I say “huge check,” I mean it in two ways.
For starters, it was physically very large. But it also was made out to the tune of $12,500, which is also huge. The presentation was made last Wednesday, October 7, at a dinner held at Proietti’s Restaurant.
The Rochester “Challenger” Miracle Field is an adaptive sports field to be built in Webster for special needs individuals and Wounded Warriors. There are 10,000 special needs individuals in the Rochester area that will be able to utilize the Miracle Field.
Despite the rainy weather on Saturday many individuals braved the elements and attended the Festival. The weather improved a abit on Sunday, and the crowds came out to enjoy the festival. The Garlic Festival featured all-day entertainment by local bands as well as a variety of food trucks, garlic vendors, craft and specialty vendors. Food demos and lectures and discussions on growing garlic proved popular with many of the attendees.
The Webster Garlic Festival Association board members are already planning the 2016 festival. To find out more, click on www.webstergarlicfestival.com or go on Facebook and friend Webster Garlic Festival.
Congratulations to the festival organizers — the Webster Rotary, Webster Lions and Webster Kiwanis clubs — for a fantastic event and to everyone who braved the elements to attend. I’m already looking forward to next year.
